Over-ridding it with a blank definition allows the controller's methods
to be tested

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/documentcloud/jammit into bin_root

* 'master' of https://github.com/documentcloud/jammit:
  Fixes a typo.
  Fixed SASS test, it actually cares about single vs double quotes.
  Actually sets :jsmin as DEFAULT_JAVASCRIPT_COMPRESSOR AND :cssmin as DEFAULT_CSS_COMPRESSOR. They both are loaded inside `lib/jammit/dependencies.rb`
  cssmin and jsmin is the new minimum requirements of jammit. YUI is now optional.
  Added sass, cssmin, and jsmin to Gemfile as part of development+test requirements.
  Removed unecessary abstraction of YUI compressors.
  Refactor of Jammit.
  Late instantiation of Jammit::Compressor
  Added test for no-rewrite-relative-paths.
  Replace invalid font/* MIME types with valid ones, to suppress WebKit warnings
  Bad merge.
  Added rewrite_relative_paths.
  Erase has_rdoc
  Edit s.date = to current date time with proper format
  Fix for undefined RAILS_ENV (when running under Rake there's no Rails.env).

Merge pull request #227 from didip/master

Refactor of Jammit
Fixed SASS test, it actually cares about single vs double quotes.
Actually sets :jsmin as DEFAULT_JAVASCRIPT_COMPRESSOR AND :cssmin as DEFAULT_CSS_COMPRESSOR. They both are loaded inside `lib/jammit/dependencies.rb`

cssmin and jsmin is the new minimum requirements of jammit. YUI is now optional.

Also, cssmin and jsmin are no longer vendored. They are now part of jammit.gemspec dependencies.
Added sass, cssmin, and jsmin to Gemfile as part of development+test requirements.
Removed unecessary abstraction of YUI compressors.

Refactor of Jammit.

* Upgraded development and test Gemfile

* Able to switch to 4 different JS compressors: jsmin, yui, closure, or uglifier.

* Able to switch to 3 different CSS compressors: cssmin, yui, or sass.

* New attributes: Jammit.css_compressors and Jammit.javascript_compressors.

* All tests now explicitly use :yui

* New compressors:

    lib/jammit/cssmin_compressor.rb
    lib/jammit/jsmin_compressor.rb
    lib/jammit/sass_compressor.rb
    lib/jammit/yui_css_compressor.rb
    lib/jammit/yui_javascript_compressor.rb

* Absorbed cssmin and jsmin. See: (https://github.com/rgrove/jsmin and https://github.com/rgrove/cssmin)

* All tests pass.

Late instantiation of Jammit::Compressor

At least one method inside Jammit::Packager, individual_urls, does not need @compressor.

Skipping Compressor.new is nice because it calls `java -version` inside initialize.

Rails 2.x doesn't like it when a Jammit route's extension contains a "." as in "html.mustache". Added a hack to fix this problem and a test to test it.

* Added the ability to specify a template extension with template_extension option.
* Jammit::Compressor now calculates the longest common base path for a package's JST files and uses the path relative from this base path as the `template_name` in the `Jammit::Compressor#compile_jst` javascript. If there is no common base path or if there is only one JST file in the package, `Jammit::Compressor#compile_jst` just uses the basename of the file.

* Renamed/rearranged all the test fixtures.

JS+JST patch attempt 2. Includes Jeremy's syntax adjustents and ruby constants for JS_EXT and JST_EXT.

Based on 629a65f6fb07ab355c1ae17cf59faaa8f61c304b + 4fa90c22d35ded1a66ef69b295b9cd285ebe473c + 10584fd366b248d8a3659cc95d4bab4d16a2e90e.

There are 4 additions to Jammit's test suite that show the additional functionality of this patch. In test/config/assets.yml I've added a second javascript package, test2, which includes all the fixtures/src .js and .jst files. test/fixtures/jammed.test2.js is what we expect Jammit to produce: all the js and jst files combined and minified.

1. command_line_test.rb:15: the command line test now ensures that from the command line, jammit produces test2.js (*.js and *.jst combined and minified).
2. test_packager.rb:11-12: a test to ensure that in development mode (package_assets: off) include_javascripts includes an individual URL for the JST files so they get built on every request.
3. test_packager.rb:27-28: ensure that the test2 package gets packaged as expected and includes the .js files and .jst files from fixtures/src, combined and minified.
4. test_packager.rb:38-39: ensure that, even though there is no test2 **jst** package specified in assets.yml, jammit will respond to pack_templates(:test2) -- this is used **only in development mode (package_assets: off)**.

Please note that if you include jst files in a :js package, you **should not** use the include_templates helper: this will cause the jst files to be loaded twice in development mode (once by include_javascripts and once by include_templates) and will cause a 404 in production because the jst files are included in the js file and don't exist on their own.

Revert "A somewhat hacky but not /that/ hacky patch to allow javascripts listed in assets.yml to include JST. It's a little hacky because I didn't want to refactor too much of the code and I wanted to leave in the ability to specify templates the old way. This patch adds a special URL to JS packages that include at least one .jst file (see packager.rb:135). Next since we need to be able to serve the JST package in development (via the special URL mentioned above) we have to fall back to the JS packages in the package_for method."

This reverts commit 629a65f6fb07ab355c1ae17cf59faaa8f61c304b.

A somewhat hacky but not /that/ hacky patch to allow javascripts listed in assets.yml to include JST. It's a little hacky because I didn't want to refactor too much of the code and I wanted to leave in the ability to specify templates the old way. This patch adds a special URL to JS packages that include at least one .jst file (see packager.rb:135). Next since we need to be able to serve the JST package in development (via the special URL mentioned above) we have to fall back to the JS packages in the package_for method.

The other nice thing going on here is that JST files get compressed along with the JS files during actual packaging.
